runs.comm: Bollinger slams one down on a length to start, and Amla hops back in defence
once again Bollinger keeps Amla deep in his crease with a rising delivery. Good pace too

pulled to deep square leg! Amla didn't look in complete control of the shot, and it definitely didn't come off the middle of the bat, but he committed to the stroke and managed to hit it well enough to get four
hit that! Bollinger's response is to dig one in at his feet, and the ball balloons high over Amla's head. A clear wide
that's a better length, Amla hopping back in defence. He could go a touch fuller with this new ball though ...
that's the length! Amla was drawn half forward but couldn't get anywhere near the pitch of the ball, and was beaten on the outside edge as he poked at it

bowled him! Bollinger strikes for Australia. Once again he's nicely full and Amla is caught on the crease when he should really have been forward. He swished across the line at the delivery but looked back to see his off stump pegged back. This is going to be a tricky chase for South Africa ...
beaten outside off! Cummins jagged one away from Smith off the wicket. To the batsman's credit, he did keep his bat just inside the line
full and wide. Smith jabs down at it, bottom edging it into the ground and back to the keeper
nicely full once again from Cummins, who has to stoop low in his follow through to stop Smith's drive
leading edge! Smith didn't know much about this. He was attempting a shovel to leg but the ball seamed and bounce, took the leading edge, and bounced just over the leaping point fielder
and now he's almost trod on his own stumps ... Smith jumped back to tuck a ball away to leg but slipped a little as he played the shot. No major harm done
Ingram safely negotiates his first delivery, defending to point
flicked off the pads, just the one run
seam and bounce for Bollinger! He's enjoying these conditions. Ingram was just beginning to edge away to the leg side but Bollinger followed him with an aggressive, rising delivery
shot! Ingram stands bravely tall as Bollinger sends down another short delivery, pulling in front of midwicket. The ball raced to the boundary on this velvet outfield
beaten, slashing outside off. Ingram probably tried to slap this one a little too hard as Bollinger offered up some width
a well-judged single. Ingram nudged one off the hip to backward square and the call from Smith was immediate
cunning placement from the former captain! Smith moved back and across, hitting the ball well enough to beat the man at short fine leg
chopped on! Ingram tried to seize on a touch of width from Cummins but this time he played over the top of it, and the inside edge cannoned into his stumps. South Africa wobble ...
a testing delivery, aimed at the top of off, is defended back to the bowler
this is attacking stuff from Cummins. He's aiming at the stumps. This one was a little fuller, and Duminy dug it out to mid off

the slower ball bouncer! Duminy had decided to pull out of the way, but it was a good delivery all the same, and it gets a jeering roar from the Wanderers crowd. A compliment for any visiting fast bowler ...

quality cricket from Australia. A searing Cummins delivery finds a thick edge, and David Hussey tumbles to his right at a wide slip to cling onto the chance. The 'wrong' Hussey? Perhaps not. South Africa are really struggling, and Smith now has a chance to go from zero to hero ...
full, fast, and tentatively tapped to mid on
a slow offcutter, not picked by Smith! He had stepped forward in defence but played too soon at it. Fortunately for him, there was no-one at short extra cover
Smith swings a length delivery down to fine leg for one
Botha comes half forward to defend a length delivery back to the bowler
slammed to deep midwicket! A bit of a nothing delivery from Bollinger, not short enough to be called a bouncer, and Botha stepped back to hammer it into the leg side
a touch predictably, he follows that up with a proper bouncer. Botha ducks beneath it in good time
inside edged past the stumps! Botha looked to punch this delivery to cover, but it seamed in a touch to take the inside edge, rocketing past the stumps and down to fine leg
on a good, full length, and Smith pushes to cover
shorter from Pattinson, and Smith is beaten by pace and bounce as he steps back to pull, wearing one on the body
whipped powerfully off the pads, but there's protection out at deep midwicket
forced wristily to cover off the back foot, Botha unable to penetrate the off-side field
a tip-and-run single to midwicket is on offer as Botha fends one-handed to leg

slapped hard, but straight to the man at short fine leg! This was a good shot from Smith, and if he'd hit it a yard on either side of the fielder, it would have been four. No luck though, and he has to be content with a scampered single
whipped off the toes, the ball rolling to midwicket
Botha steps across to off and flicks one to short fine leg
clubbed down the ground, but long on sprints round and saves the boundary
tapped back down the track, Hussey scurrying across to field off his own bowling

has he been stumped? Smith went down on one knee and attempted a slog-sweep, but missed it and Wade had the bails off in a flash. But did the batsman raise his back foot after the shot? He did not, and that's not out. A cheer from the crowd ...
shovelled out to deep midwicket, and they hurry back for the second
floated up on middle and leg, Botha working the ball to wide long on with plenty of bottom hand
swept out to long leg, just the single
skied, but the chance falls safely! Botha tried to go over long off but sliced at it. Both White and Warner charged over, Warner went for it in the end but the ball bounced in front of him
pushed down the ground
driven to long on, just the single
slammed back hard, but straight at the bowler
boom! Smith lumbers down the track and clobbers one over deep midwicket. That was a bit of a crowd-killer

but he's gone now! There'll be no match-saving innings from Smith. He tried to nudge this into the leg side but got a thick leading edge that flew back at Hussey, who made no mistake. South Africa are in some serious bother now. Time for a Parnell special?
pushed defensively to backward point off the front foot
more defence from the left-hander
he's off the mark now, driving a full ball out to long off
over-throw! Botha flicked to midwicket, and is allowed through for a single by a wild shy at the striker's end
whipped with plenty of wrist to long on. Watch out for that leading edge ...
Miller uses his feet well to get to the pitch, cracking the ball hard out to deep midwicket, where a good sliding stop from Mitchell Marsh saves runs
pushed straight at the midwicket fielder
a touch too short. Miller tries to make the most of it, rocking back to pull, but there's a sweeper out at deep midwicket
chopped down to short third man, and they take a sprinted single
a top edge goes for four! Miller was trying to slog sweep, but the ball took the edge, flew over Wade's head, and down to the boundary
good line on off stump, dropped square of the wicket on the off side and the non-striker has to get a hurry on
banged in back of a length, goes for the pull but only gets a bottom edge that rolls to midwicket
outside leg stump, takes the pad towards square leg
ooh, he gets away with that one as it's a touch short and wide but Botha plays over the top of the ball
good short ball, rises over off stump and Botha sways out of the line...valuable dot balls for Australia
sprays this well wide of off stump and that's an easy decision for the umpire
good comeback, excellent delivery tails in towards middle stump and Botha can only dig it out into the off side
straight delivery which is pushed in the off side
dropped in short and Marsh gets some of his own medicine as Botha pulls it well into the stands at deep square leg
now he pushes this down the leg side, so pressure on Marsh
gets back outside off and Botha opens the face to find third man
slower ball, very full outside off and it's driven out to the cover sweeper
not much bounce on this which means Botha can't connect with his attempt at a cut
close! Nearly a wicket for Marsh as Botha comes down the pitch and drives a fraction early, but the ball falls short of cover who is on the edge of the circle
top shot from Botha, he's playing well, as he drives this on the up through the covers
now takes advantage of more width outside, this time he goes squarer through point which makes the cover sweeper cover some ground
full delivery whipped from outside off down to long on
good yorker, Miller tries to force it away but can only push it back to the bowler
big wicket! Pattinson is on target, was quite a full delivery and Miller tried to pull it through midwicket from a crouched position but is middle stump is rattled
defended into the off side
whipped through midwicket
lovely bowling, tossed up a little more and it spins past the outside edge
comes in with the arm and Kuhn drives to cover
goes for sweep from outside off, doesn't make contact, the pressure grows
connects this time with the sweep but it's only a single to deep square
that could be the game! Botha goes for the reverse sweep, it comes off the top edge and finds short third man
excellent yorker outside off stump, Kuhn chops over the top of the ball
a very straight drive and it takes out the non-striker's leg stump then deflects away towards midwicket
short outside off, Kuhn goes for the pull but only connects with fresh air
gone! They are falling quickly now. A sharp return catch by a quick bowler. Kuhn went for the drive and Pattinson took it cleanly a little to his right
starts with a firm drive through the covers but South Africa need a miracle from here
back of length, turned through midwicket off the back foot
nips back into the pads then bounces out towards backward point
on leg stump, turned away in front of square
a slower ball is nicely picked up over midwicket, the fielder from deep square puts in a good chase and dive to flick it back then let it go before he rolled over the boundary
short from Cummins and too short
worked off leg stump to midwicket
whipped strong off leg stump but again it goes straight to the boundary rider at deep square
that's a blooper from O'Keefe at third man...Parnell opened the face, it shoulder have been a single but O'Keefe treated the ball like a bar of soap and let it through.
well, Theron hasn't given up as he unleashes a strong cover drive that races to the boundary
now this one flies off the edge down to third man...oh, superb fielding this time by O'Keefe as he dives full length as that looked like another boundary
home side still just alive here, Theron picks up a good length delivery and pulls it over midwicket with a short-arm jab
responds with a dot ball, but perhaps a little fortunate because it was short of a length again and Theron misses his pull
lofted down the ground to long off
touch fuller to Parnell who gets in inside edge into his pads and the ball rolls towards point
round the wicket, goes for a slog sweep and doesn't connect
this one comes out of the middle as it is crunched straight back over the bowler's head...almost took out the umpire, too
that's big! Down the pitch and flicked over deep square leg, not a huge amount of power but it flew
pushed square on the off side between short third man and point
opens the face and steers it to backward point. South Africa have what they need off this over
oh boy, what a blow. What an surge from South Africa. Swung high over midwicket by Parnell
not a great start, short and down the leg side...this is pressure for an 18-year-old
moves across his stumps, shapes to swing it over the leg side but it comes off the pads
and that will make it even better, short of a length and Parnell picks it up beautifully over midwicket with a pull off one leg over midwicket
fire down the leg side...momentum all with South Africa now. How quickly a game can change
comes round the wicket, pitched full on off stump and Parnell calmly pushes towards cover
what a blow, that looks like the match, Theron picks up a length delivery over midwicket and it lands just short of the rope
banged in short, that had some heat on it as it flew past an attempted pull shot
full outside off, clubbed down the ground to long on
that's the game! Wins it with a six. What a comeback from South Africa. Down on one knee and Theron launches it over midwicket to spark the celebrations
